data.title: Living the Artist's Way — live workshop series with Julia Cameron
data.text:
Join us for this very special three-part event with Julia Cameron.

During this 3-session virtual intensive, Julia Cameron will teach the fundamentals from her classic bestseller The Artist's Way and her brand-new book Living the Artist's Way.

Drawing from her decades of experience, Julia's wisdom will free you as a writer so you can finally make your ideas a reality.

Together we will explore the foundational tools that make a writing life possible, like:

Morning Pages

Artist Dates

Meditative Walking

Outside Guidance

Moving on from the fundamentals, she will outline how writing is not dependent on mood.

Contrary to common writing mythology — which tells us writers need special times, special places, and even special pens — you will learn how to write at any time and in any place by the end of this class.

The three 90-minute workshops will take place March 13, March 20 & March 27 at 4 pm PST/7 pm EST

Each session will include time for Q&A, and every attendee will get access to replays for four months.

About the Author

Hailed by the New York Times as “The Queen of Change,” Julia Cameron is credited with starting a movement in 1992 that has brought creativity into the mainstream conversation— in the arts, in business, and in everyday life. She is the best-selling author of more than 40 books, fiction and nonfiction; a poet, songwriter, filmmaker, and playwright. Commonly referred to as “The Godmother” or “High Priestess” of creativity, her tools are based in practice, not theory, and she considers herself “the floor sample of her own toolkit.” The Artist’s Way has been translated into forty languages and sold over five million copies to date.

Click here to visit her website
